@HelenVi00175623 @maricaoneill @ClareDinnisEA @EnvAgency @DefraGovUK @pow_rebecca @transportgovuk @StaffordshireCC @AaronBell4NUL @SimonTagg @StinkStopthe There are a couple of things for Newcastle Borough Council to answer.

text: @markday331 @EmmaHowardBoyd @Ofwat @OfwatChair @DefraGovUK @EnvAgency @JamesBevanEA @CleanIlkley These are proposed trials (out for consultation until 9th June: https://t.co/xuxJW8bX2y) on waters not even yet designated... two large-scale pilots to deliver bathing-quality water in the Rivers Avon & Leam in Warwickshire & River Teme in Shropshire, at a total cost of Â£152.686M

@markday331 @EmmaHowardBoyd @Ofwat @OfwatChair @DefraGovUK @EnvAgency @JamesBevanEA The way the legislation is written means that rivers can only currently be designated when they meet the criteria for the level of use by people for bathing activities- @CleanIlkley paved the way for this to be considered for every river used in this way https://t.co/v2SfY0C7YX

text: @EnvAgencyAnglia @huntsdc @stneotscouncil So you worked with anglers but was the #ecology of the river considered?  The @EnvAgency has a dead wood policy, here not a sign of compromise, basically blitzing the river and banks. mammal surveys? Any consideration for wildlife in May?! FOI on rationale.

@EnvAgencyAnglia @huntsdc @stneotscouncil This work is actually acting to impede river health and reduce biodiversity. For example, fallen branches are also known as snags and are important for controlling river flow rate and preventing flooding downstream.
